author: D J Walter Scott
text:
After a brief lull during the north-east monsoon, Sengapadai, a nondescript village in Kamudhi taluk in the district was abuzz with activity as Adani Green Energy (Tamil Nadu) Limited speeded up work to meet the target of generating power by early April.

The Adani Group is setting up a 648 MW solar power plant with an outlay of Rs 4,536 crore and began preliminary work in August last year and completed about 50 per cent of work. It plans to complete the project by March 31.

The solar panels and other equipment are in place and they have already started generating about 200 to 250 MW of power, sources said. The company has handed over about 50 acres of land to Tangedco for setting up two sub stations for transmitting power. Tangedco wanted to complete construction of sub stations at the earliest but the rains and floods have delayed the work, the sources said. By the time they complete the 400/230/110 KV sub stations, the company would be in a position to make available the full capacity of 648 MW of power to Tangedo, the sources added.
title: Adani plant hopes to generate power by April
